author: Bob Quinlan
comment: Wear Gesture Launcher lets you start an app with a simple tap-then-gesture combination.  It should work with almost any watch face.  It is faster than any other launcher I have used.  This launcher solves a fundamental problem with Wear launchers.  The user interface on a watch is just never going to be good at selecting one item from a large collection.  Wear Gesture Launcher eliminates the need to display everything you could choose by letting you create your own gestures for the apps you use regularly.  Wear Gesture Launcher works very well.  It's easy to set up, fast to use, and reliable.  It is not intended to replace the default launcher entirely, but it does eliminate the need to use it at least 90% of the time for me.

author: Nik Brooks
comment: Well I have to say that this is one clever application and what a great idea. Seems to work very well indeed and I look forward to seeing new updates in the future..... excellent!!!

author: Scott Almond
comment: Useful tool. Will be 5 star when phone app shortcut launching and tasker integration is possible

reply.author: FormatZ
reply.content: Hi Scott! Tasker integration is finally here, hope you would like it

author: Dan Edens
comment: 5 stars for promised tasker intergration! Wooooo

author: Jelle Edens
comment: Very nice addition to other launcher!

author: Wesley Simon
comment: Love the app so far, it's awesome how fast, accurate and smooth it works. However, there is lots that could be added. Would love to be able to launch any app, including system apps with it. Also what about other actions like changing watch settings, volume, etc. Also would love to initiate the gesture recognition with a hardware button instead of the overlay button. Also would be nice if it didn't matter the direction you draw the gesture, but just compared the final image image. Tasker integration would be amazing!

reply.author: FormatZ
reply.content:
Hi Wesley, Tasker Integration is finally here! Hope you will enjoy it 
Thanks for the feedback! Actually now you already can assign this app to the hardware button in the system settings, and by turning off the overlay button in the app settings you can perform gestures directly! Also will try to add those options soon, thanks!

author: Jan Harley
comment: Couldn't get the app to even open on my watch, let alone set it up or use it.  Very disappointed.

reply.author: FormatZ
reply.content:
Sorry to cause inconvenience, could you tell me which watch are you using and what system version is it?
If your watch is running Oreo (android 8.0), the newest update will soon solve the problem, thanks!

comment: Great app for easily and quickly access key apps on Android smartwatch! However, Would it be possible to have an option to disable the screen corners and instead go into gesture mode by launching the app? That way I could trigger the gesture capture through an app launch complication or a hardware button instead of a screen corner overlay, which actually blocks some Wear functions no matter which corner.  [2017-11-22] thanks for the latest update! The additional features (gesture capture on app launch and different screen corner sizes) are definitely a great addition! Now it is so convenient to open any app on my Wear watch.

reply.author: FormatZ
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion! It is definitely possible, will be developed  in the next version!

author: sachin gupta
comment: Excellent app but its setting overlay for apps which are also connected with right corners. You cant operate such apps. The app with which it is not compatible is wear mini launcher. When you swipe from left to right, app drawer will open but to close the app drawar, right to left swipe is needed. This swipe is not possible due to your app.

reply.author: FormatZ
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback! The customizable overlay position setting is now available in this version, update the wearable app and you can change it in settings in the app!

author: John Newman
comment: Excellent app. Lacking the ability to access some functions like timer and stopwatch is disappointing, but maybe these can be added later.

reply.author: FormatZ
reply.content: Now the timer, alarm, stopwatch and more functions have been added to the newest version! Thanks for the feedback!

author: Debarghya Kumar Chakraborty
comment: Love it! Very responsive and easy to use

author: Daniel S
comment: works well.. just wish i had the ability to change brightness, wifi and sound settings ... or perhaps open all the apps.. (app drawer)  Thank you.
